nodes.text: I am glad to have you here today, How are you feeling?
How long have you been feeling like this?
Thats good to hear!
Has a doctor ever prescribed medication to you to help with depression, anxiety, behavior, or mental problems (such as Ritalin, antidepressants, etc.)?
What were they prescribed for?
Did they seem to help?
Are you still on this medication today?
Have you sought out any professional medical service in the last 30 days?
Have you ever been placed in a psychiatric hospital?
What was the reason you were in a psychiatric hospital?
Have you had any suicidal thoughts lately?
Is there any reason why?
What about any thoughts about self-harm?
Have you though of hurting others?
Have you ever been arrested or charged with a crime before?
What was the crime that you commited?
When was the last time you commited a crime?
Have you ever committed a serious offense that you never took legal action for?
Do you have any support groups like friends or family that you can talk to?
Have you tried including your family in your support group?
Have you tried including your friends in your support group?
Have you tried talking to your friends and family about how you are feeling?
That's good, it's good to have someone to talk to.
You should have someone outside of therapy to talk to about these feelings you are having.
Are you actively working right now?
Where are you working?
Do you enjoy working there?
How are your coworkers? Can you tell me something interesting about one of them?
When did you last work?
What was your reasoning for leaving?
How are you paying for your bills at the moment?
Have you been taking any non-prescribed drugs?
Drugs and alcohol can be highly addictive, you should try to refrain from taking them in high quantities.
Good. Drugs and alcohol can be highly addictive.
Are you doing any physical activities?
How about any social organized events?
Good, physical activity and socializing with others is good for your mental health.
You should look for some group sports its good for your mental health.
You should look for some group sports its good for your mental health.
Do you play any games or video games in your free time?
What is your favorite game?
Why is that your favourite game?
That's good to hear, it's good to have a stress reliever that you can have at any moments notice
How come you dont play games?
Video games are a great way to relieve stress and are available almost always so you should try to find a game that you may enjoy. It can really help brighten ones mood!
Okay that wraps up our session for today. For homework this week you should write down how you are feeling each day on a scale from 1-100. Can you do it for me?
Do you want to know more about medicine, sports or games that can help you?
Great, hope to see you next week!
